item.title: Speed limit sign round wrong way, 16th January
item.description:
The speed limit sign at the end of Footscray Road where it meets Eltham High Street by the Sainsbury's petrol station has been turned round incorrectly. It now says 30mph for the high street and 20mph for Footscray Road which is wrong and could make drivers speed on the high street and cause an accident.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footscray Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Greencroft Gardens between numbers 65 and 67 the street lamp is not working., 16th January
item.description:
There is something wrong with the site/app. I have spent 15 minutes trying to report this, and the options for 'Street Furniture' were few and had nothing to do with street lamps. I think the problem street light hasn't been working since around 13 January 2026. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Greencroft Gardens, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wire exposed and hanging right in the middle of pavement, 16th January
item.description:
Wire hanging outside of 33-35 Palace View, near post DP941. This seems to be the same issue mentioned in ticket 8193846 that was raised in Sept 2025. However in January 2026 a wire is still hanging around. It is dark in winter tall people can easily get struck by it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace View, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There's a large pothole or other subsidence, 16th January
item.description:
There's a very large pothole or other subsidence at this location, to the point that it could cause damage to vehicles or, worse, cause (eg) motorcycle riders to come off. I note the previous report but as that's from last October, it needs reporting again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping outside St Mungo’s Crimscott Street, 16th January
item.description:
Repeated flytipping on and around the bins that belong to the hostel. The hostel needs support to get a better solution for their bins so that the flytipping problem (which isn’t from the shelter as I understand it) has a chance of stopping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Crimscott Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked - huge puddle - Valley Rd, 10m SE of jct with Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, South side of the Rd., 16th January
item.description:
Drain blocked - huge puddle - Valley Rd, 10m SE of jct with Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, South side of the Rd. On Thu 15/1/26 the puddle was about 6 feet wide by 10 feet long. Today Fri 16/1/26 there is still standing water about 3 feet wide by 6 feet long. This drain is at the foot of the rising land of Shortlands Rd and Mays Hill Rd. Autumn leaves have not been cleared. They wash down into this drain making it regularly block. Neglect and cost avoidance to clear autumn leaves by one part of the Council creates more complex and expensive to clear work for the drainage department of the Council. Please sort out this situation and clear the leaves too in Shortlands Rd and Mays Hill Rd, or the drain will just clog up again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White Vauxhall Van DV19YPC left on white Zigzag lines, 16th January
item.description:
Reg DV19YPC White Vauxhall Van. Along the lordship lane, opposite LL estate/ near traffic lights near Overhill Road or between bus stop DJ-DH. Left on zigzag lines since yesterday early evening (Thursday 15th January) and all day today. Still there now late this evening. Causing obstruction to other vehicles buses and emergency services trying to get past especially during rush hours.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in private bin store, 16th January
item.description:
Someone is driving on to private land unloading lots of rubbish in to a communal bin shared by flats. This is not residents rubbish. This has happened twice this week and means the bin is now overflowing with residents now unable to use this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
